Tutorial for fine-mapping with functional priors

Kaixuan Luo, Alan Selewa

Source: vignettes/finemapping_tutorial.Rmd
finemapping_tutorial.Rmd

In this tutorial, we perform fine-mapping (using SuSiE) with functional priors computed from the enrichment analysis using TORUS.

Load the packages.

library(mapgen)

Input data

Please see the data preparation tutorial about preparing GWAS summary statistics.

We need a bigSNP object for the reference genotype panel, which will be used for computing LD matrices. See the data preparation tutorial for details.

SNP-level priors

Following the enrichment analysis tutorial, we can obtain SNP-level priors using run_torus() with option = "est-prior".

gwas.sumstats <- readRDS(system.file('extdata', 'test.processed.sumstats.rds', package='mapgen'))
torus.res <- readRDS(system.file('extdata', 'test.torus.res.rds', package='mapgen'))
torus.prior <- torus.res$snp_prior

Now, we can add the SNP-level priors to our summary statistics.

gwas.sumstats <- prepare_susie_data_with_torus_result(sumstats = gwas.sumstats, 
                                                      torus_prior = torus.prior)

We see we have a new column called torus_prior.

as.data.frame(gwas.sumstats[1:5,])
##   chr   pos a0 a1     beta      se                   snp    pval     zscore
## 1   1 13110  A  G -0.02066 0.03231           1:13110:G:A 0.52245 -0.6394305
## 2   1 13116  G  T -0.01255 0.01895 rs201725126:13116:T:G 0.50772 -0.6622691
## 3   1 13118  G  A -0.01255 0.01895 rs200579949:13118:A:G 0.50772 -0.6622691
## 4   1 13550  A  G  0.13184 0.11236           1:13550:G:A 0.24066  1.1733713
## 5   1 14604  G  A  0.02221 0.01863           1:14604:A:G 0.23333  1.1921632
##   locus og_index bigSNP_index torus_prior
## 1     1        3            4  2.0005e-06
## 2     1        4            5  1.5111e-05
## 3     1        5            6  1.5111e-05
## 4     1        7           11  1.5111e-05
## 5     1       10           14  1.5111e-05

We could limit loci with GWAS p-value cutoff (e.g.Â 5e-8), or if you want to limit loci with FDR cutoff, you can use the FDR associated with each locus obtained from running run_torus() with option = "fdr".

Fine-mapping

We can then perform fine-mapping using SuSiE, you will need the susieR and bigsnpr packages for the steps below.

library(susieR)
library(bigsnpr)

To use SNP-level priors computed from TORUS, we use run_finemapping() with priortype = 'torus'.

susie.finemap.res <- run_finemapping(sumstats = gwas.sumstats, 
                                     bigSNP = bigSNP, 
                                     priortype = 'torus', 
                                     L = 1)

You can also run fine-mapping using uniform prior (without SNP-level priors) with priortype = 'uniform'. (You donâ€™t need to run TORUS if you run fine-mapping using uniform prior.)

Note that we ran SuSiE with L = 1 here, meaning we assumed there is at most one causal variant per SNP. This is conservative to avoid potential inflation of signals due to mismatch between GWAS and the LD reference.

susie.finemap.res is a list of SuSiE results, one for each locus.

We can merge GWAS summary statistics with SuSiE result:

finemap.sumstats <- merge_susie_sumstats(susie_results = susie.finemap.res, 
                                         sumstats = gwas.sumstats)

We now have a new column called susie_pip which is the probability of a SNP being causal estimated using SuSiE.

as.data.frame(finemap.sumstats[1:5,])
##   chr   pos a0 a1     beta      se                   snp    pval     zscore
## 1   1 13110  A  G -0.02066 0.03231           1:13110:G:A 0.52245 -0.6394305
## 2   1 13116  G  T -0.01255 0.01895 rs201725126:13116:T:G 0.50772 -0.6622691
## 3   1 13118  G  A -0.01255 0.01895 rs200579949:13118:A:G 0.50772 -0.6622691
## 4   1 13550  A  G  0.13184 0.11236           1:13550:G:A 0.24066  1.1733713
## 5   1 14604  G  A  0.02221 0.01863           1:14604:A:G 0.23333  1.1921632
##   locus og_index bigSNP_index torus_prior susie_pip CS
## 1     1        3            4  2.0005e-06         0  0
## 2     1        4            5  1.5111e-05         0  0
## 3     1        5            6  1.5111e-05         0  0
## 4     1        7           11  1.5111e-05         0  0
## 5     1       10           14  1.5111e-05         0  0
